entry.b: Operating System Instance, OS Instance, or OSI

Generally, customers may not mix per-Physical Server and per-OS Instance models to deploy and manage a single cloud. However, customers may license the Software under a Per-Physical Server license to manage on premise servers and also license the Software under a Per OS Instance license to manage instances in a Public Cloud.

Per Server License: If purchased under a per Physical Server license, then customer may Use the HP Helion CloudSystem Enterprise Software to manage cloud services that run on no more than the specified number of licensed Physical Servers. The right to Use this Software may not be transferred from any licensed Physical Server to a new or replacement Physical Server. In addition, customer may use this Software to manage OS Instances on public clouds for non-production use environments so long as the number of public cloud-based OS Instances managed does not exceed at any one time the number of Physical Server licenses that Customer purchased.

Per OS Instance License: If purchased under a per OS Instance license, then customer may Use the HP Helion CloudSystem Enterprise Software to manage cloud services so long as the total number of OS Instances used by the cloud services does not exceed at any one time the number of OS Instances that the customer has purchased.

HP Helion Development Platform software, included as part of the Software, may only run on a physical server licensed for the Software. Vertica Software included as part of the Software may only be used to provide database features to monitor and report on performance and health of the Software. The maximum permitted size of the Vertica Software database is 12TB.
All components of the HP Helion CloudSystem Enterprise Software are delivered collectively as a single, non-decomposable product that must be supported, upgraded, and updated as a whole.

p.b: Security Bulletin and Alert Policy for Non-HP Owned Software Components

section.p: HP addresses security bulletins for the software components listed in this ALA with the same level of support afforded HP products. HP is committed to reducing security defects and helping you mitigate the risks associated with security defects when they do occur.

HP has a well-defined process when a security defect is found that culminates with the publication of a security bulletin. The security bulletin provides you with a high level description of the problem and explains how to mitigate the security defect.

li.b: Procedure for Subscribing to Security Bulletins:

ol.li: Open a browser to the HP home page: http://www.HP.com/
Click the Support & Drivers tab.
Click Sign up: driver, support, & security alerts, which appears under Additional Resources in the right navigation pane.
Select Business & IT Professionals to open the Subscriber's Choice web page.

Do one of the following:
Sign in if you are a registered customer.
Enter your email address to sign-up now. Select Driver and Support alerts and click Continue.
